DOC.brief_summary: This study compares of the safety and efficacy of intravenous iron vs oral iron in the treatment of anemia secondary to heavy uterine bleeding
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of the Safety and Efficacy of Intravenous Iron Versus Oral Iron in the Treatment of Anemia Secondary to Heavy Uterine Bleeding
DOC.detailed_description: This is an open-label, randomized, Phase III, active-control, study of the efficacy and safety of IV iron vs oral iron in patients with anemia secondary to heavy uterine bleeding.
DOC.criteria: Female subjects >/= 18 years of age History of Heavy uterine bleeding Hgb </= 11 Practicing acceptable birth control Demonstrate ability to understand and comply with protocol Known Hypersensitivity to oral or IV iron Anemia other than iron deficiency anemia Iron storage disorders Initiation of treatment that may effect degree of heavy uterine bleeding Anticipated need for surgery Severe psychiatric disorder Active infection Positive Pregnancy test Known Hep B or C or Active Hepatitis Received investigational Drug within 30 days Alcohol or drug abuse
DOC.keyword: Anemia secondary to heavy uterine bleeding
